Dukung Pengusaha Kecil, BRI Pelatihan 10.000 UMKM
07 Nov 2019, 11:03 by Angling Adhitya Purbaya


Foto: Angling Adhitya Purbaya/detikcom

Semarang - PT. Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk menggelar pelatihan 10 ribu pelaku Usaha Menengah Kecil Mikro (UMKM). Mereka dilatih mulai dari manajemen keuangan, pemasaran, hingga mengetahui info pasar.Acara bertajuk Program Pelatihan 10.000 UMKM itu digelar di seluruh Indonesia dan Kantor Wilayah BRI Semarang mendapat kesempayan menggelar pelatihan di 8 lokasi dengan total 800 peserta. Di Kota Semarang ada 2 titik dan hari ini digelar Kantor Cabang Semarang Pandanaran dan Semarang Sudiarto di Hotel Novotel dengan jumlah peserta 100 orang."Program ini diikuti oleh pelaku UMKM, termasuk para UMKM cluster unggulan daerah," kata Vice President Kanwil BRI Semarang, Hasanuddin, Rabu (6/11/2019).Pelatihan ini diselenggarakan Bank BRI untuk meningkatkan kapabilitas UMKM untuk go modern, go digital, go online dan go global. Para pelaku UMKM yang hadir akan mendapatkan pelatihan terkait administrasi dan manajemen keuangan, pelatihan terkait e-commerce, akses informasi terhadap permodalan, hingga info pasar. Pelatihan tersebut juga mendatangkan dari Tokopedia."Melalui berbagai program CSR yang digelar dalam rangka HUT ke-124 Bank BRI menunjukkan komitmen menjalankan peran sebagai agent of development sehingga kehadirannya semakin memberikan kontribusi yang lebih besar pada ekonomi kerakyatan yang dihasilkan dari keselarasan antara kepentingan ekonomi, sosial dan lingkungan hidup," ujarnya.Pelatihan tersebut diikuti pelaku UMKM dengan berbagai jenis komoditas mulai dari kerajinan hingga kuliner. Komoditinya antara lain mukena, sandal, tas rajut, bandeng, dendeng, dan lainnya.Sementara itu Kepala Dinas Koperasi dan UMKM Kota Semarang, FX Bambang Suranggono mengatakan jumlah UMKM di Kota Semarang meningkat seiring kemajuan teknologi dan e-commerce."Saat ini jumlahnya ada 17.100 yang tercatat sudah berizin. Bulan Mei lalu 16.500 yang tercatat," kata Bambang.Pemkot Semarang dalam dukungan perkembangan UMKM juga mengadakan pelatihan, selain itu juga memiliki program Kredit Wibawa dengan bunga 3% per tahun dan pinjaman di bawah Rp 5 juta tidak dikenakan agunan. Tahun ini Pemkot Semarang mengucurkan Rp 11 miliar untuk pinjaman murah dan tahun depan anggarannya akan naik."Tahun 2019 sudah mengucurkan dana pinjaman murah Rp 11 miliar. Tahun 2020 ada Rp 15 miliar," jelasnya.Menurutnya jumlah anggaran tersebut masih belum cukup untuk dikucurkan kepada UMKM yang terus meningkat jumlahnya, maka peran perbankan penting termasuk dari BRI yang juga dilengkapi dengan pelatihan untuk UMKM."Maka gandeng stakeholder seperti BRI. Support Small Entrepreneurs, BRI Training 10,000 MSMEs
Nov 7 2019, 11:03 by Angling Adhitya Purbaya


Photo: Angling Adhitya Purbaya / detikcom

Semarang - PT. Bank Rakyat Indonesia (Persero) Tbk held a training of 10 thousand Micro and Small Medium Enterprises (MSMEs). They were trained ranging from financial management, marketing, to knowing market information. The event titled 10,000 UMKM Training Program was held throughout Indonesia and BRI Semarang Regional Office had the opportunity to hold training in 8 locations with a total of 800 participants. In Semarang City there are 2 points and today the Semarang Pandanaran Branch Office and Semarang Sudiarto are being held at the Novotel Hotel with 100 participants. "The program is participated by SMEs, including regional superior MSME clusters," said Vice President of BRI Semarang Regional Office, Hasanuddin , Wednesday (11/06/2019). The training was held by Bank BRI to improve the capability of MSMEs to go modern, go digital, go online and go global. The SMEs who attend will get training related to administration and financial management, training related to e-commerce, access to information on capital, to market information. The training also brought from Tokopedia. "Through various CSR programs held in the context of the 124th anniversary of Bank BRI shows a commitment to play a role as an agent of development so that its presence increasingly contributes more to the people's economy resulting from harmony between economic, social interests and the environment, "he said. The training was followed by SMEs with various types of commodities ranging from crafts to culinary delights. Commodities include mukena, sandals, knitting bags, milkfish, beef jerky, and others. Meanwhile, Head of the Cooperative and UMKM Office of the City of Semarang, FX Bambang Suranggono said the number of MSMEs in the City of Semarang increased with advances in technology and e-commerce. "17,100 registered are licensed. Last May 16,500 were registered," said Bambang. Semarang City Government in support of the development of MSMEs also held training, in addition to that they also had the Authority Credit program with an interest rate of 3% per year and loans under Rp. 5 million were not subject to collateral . This year the Semarang City Government disbursed Rp 11 billion for cheap loans and next year the budget will increase. "In 2019, it has disbursed cheap loans of Rp 11 billion. In 2020 there is Rp 15 billion," he explained. According to him the amount of the budget was still not enough to be disbursed to As the number of MSMEs continues to increase, the important role of banks, including from BRI, is also equipped with training for MSMEs. "So cooperating with stakeholders such as BRI. Rp. 15 billion is not enough," he concluded.
